title: How to Dress Up As a Devil

steps.title: Anything red will work.
steps.content: Anything red will work. You could wear a red dress, a red t-shirt with red pants, a red tank top with red leggings, etc. If you're aiming for a sexy devil costume, choose red clothes that are tight-fitting. [1] X Research source

steps.title: An all-black costume is less cliché.
steps.content: An all-black costume is less cliché. While the classic devil outfit is mostly red, rules are made to be broken! Go with a sleek black dress as a base, or wear black pants with a black shirt. Black sweaters, tank tops, leggings, and shorts all work too. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Use your footwear to accentuate your look.
steps.content: Use your footwear to accentuate your look. If you want a sexier look, go with a pair of high heels or knee-high boots. You can also choose flats, boots, or even tennis shoes if you want to be more comfortable. Choose a color that matches your outfit so you have a more cohesive look. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Create that classic devil look.
steps.content: Create that classic devil look. What devil costume would be complete without a pair of horns? Choose a simple pair attached to a headband and wear them on your head. [4] X Research source For a unique twist, try crafting your own horns using foam. Shape the foam with a heat gun, seal it with a primer, and paint it to match your costume. This allows you to customize the horns to fit your vision perfectly. You could also wear costume horns that stick to your forehead.

steps.title: You can use a costume tail or make a simple one yourself.
steps.content: You can use a costume tail or make a simple one yourself. If you’ve got a classic costume devil tail, attach it to the back of your outfit. You can also make one yourself by tying a scarf around your waist so it hangs down behind you like a tail. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Accessorize your look with a classic.
steps.content: Accessorize your look with a classic. When you think of a devil costume, you probably think of horns, a tail, and of course, a pitchfork. Hold the pitchfork as a useful prop that immediately identifies your outfit as a devil. [6] X Research source

steps.title: This is optional, but it can take your look to the next level.
steps.content: This is optional, but it can take your look to the next level. Use a makeup sponge or brush and cover your face entirely. Make sure you focus on covering areas such as around your nose and your jawline. [7] X Research source You could also add false eyelashes to make your look even more dramatic.

steps.title: Some masks can make your costume look even scarier.
steps.content: Some masks can make your costume look even scarier. If you don’t want to paint your face red, put on a devil mask! It’s a simple way to make your face look more devilish. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Add a devilish touch to your look.
steps.content: Add a devilish touch to your look. Pull out an old pair of fishnet stockings and cut off the ends with a pair of scissors. Pull your hands through the material so they’re attached to your arms to create a distressed devilish pair of gloves. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Make yourself a more sophisticated devil if that’s your style.
steps.content: Make yourself a more sophisticated devil if that’s your style. Put the blazer or jacket on over your base outfit to add a touch of refinement to your look. Additionally, if it’s cold out, a blazer or jacket can help keep you warm. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Add an extra pop of color to your costume.
steps.content: Add an extra pop of color to your costume. Go with a bright red one to add a splash of color. You could also choose a black one if you want to add more mystery to your look. [11] X Research source
